text: The was an attempted coup d'état in the Empire of Japan on 26 February 1936. It was organized by a group of young Imperial Japanese Army (IJA) officers. They wanted the purging the government and military leadership because of bad economic policies. During this incident, the rebels assassinated two former prime ministers and occupied the government center of Tokyo. However, they failed in assassinating Prime Minister Keisuke Okada or take control of the Imperial Palace. Saitō Makoto was killed at his home during an attempt coup d'état. With a lot of opposition against them, the rebels surrendered on 29 February.Jansen (2002), p. 598 This was the last time that a former prime minister was killed until the assassination of Shinzo Abe in 2022. ==References== Category:Rebellions in Asia Category:20th-century rebellions Category:1930s in Japan Category:1936
title: February 26 incident
